content: Singaporean palm oil company **Golden-Agri Resources** (GAR) is a Singaporean [palm oil](/wiki/Palm_oil) company, listed on the [Singapore Stock Exchange](/wiki/Singapore_Stock_Exchange) since 1999. In May 2015, its market capitalization was $4.1 billion. Franky Widjaja, of the [Sinar Mas](/wiki/Sinar_Mas) family is its CEO. Alnoor is a subsidiary of GAR. [Lew Syn Pau](/wiki/Lew_Syn_Pau) used to serve as a member of the Singaporean Parliament for 13 years and is a member of the board of directors of the firm. ## Criticism of environmental record According to [Greenpeace](/wiki/Greenpeace), GAR has six concessions on peatlands in [Riau](/wiki/Riau), with an estimated total area of 20,000 hectares. GAR was reported to have 1,880 hectares of peat in [Central Kalimantan](/wiki/Central_Kalimantan) and 1,330 hectares in [West Kalimantan](/wiki/West_Kalimantan), while claiming a zero-deforestation footprint. Greenpeace also discovered 322 hotspots on five to GAR's concessions in Central Kalimantan. GAR denied these accusations and said to have a zero-burning policy since 1997. Interviews with senior officers revealed evidence to the contrary. In about 2010, companies such as [Burger King](/wiki/Burger_King), [Unilever](/wiki/Unilever) and [Nestl√©](/wiki/Nestl%C3%A9) cancelled their supplier contracts with Singapore-listed GAR subsidiaries due to unsustainable farming practices. Golden owns a subsidiary in [Liberia](/wiki/Liberia) called Golden Veroleum, which in 2018 was removed from the [Roundtable on Sustainable Palm Oil](/wiki/Roundtable_on_Sustainable_Palm_Oil) for alleged land acquisition violations. - Official Website This [Singaporean corporation or company](/wiki/List_of_companies_of_Singapore) article is a stub.
